Projects

One of the joys of knowing how to program is that we put lives into ideas and make them real. These are some of my projects I worked on.


SSCC Web Revamp


Technologies Used

  • python
  • BeautifulSoup
  • selenium
  • Web crawl

My Role

To Social Science Computing Cooperative, UW-Madison, I provided a python code to parse and export numerous HTML files into an XML file. This allowed to automate and fasten the process of migrating around 200 documents.

Project Description

The script reformats HTML documents into XML so that they can be migrated to a new KB site. Prior to this, the script crawled https://ssc.wisc.edu to receive all the documents within the domain, and then parsed to fit the required format.

Project Difficulty

Web migration is a tricky operation to first-comer of such project because the project always sits on the risk of starting from the beginning if one does not know what's ahead. For example, we needed to preserve the mapping of our website because links within each document breaks without a proper mapping.

My Solution

There were many articles regarding the web migration, so I read to prevent us from slowing down the project. Also, I addressed the possible issues to my coworkers and mostly was able to find a better solution. through out communication.


Algotrade


Technologies used

  • python
  • statsmodels
  • PyQt5
  • ccxt
  • ema-sma

My Role

I took responsibility of designing a scheme and flow of the application. Also, I programmed GUI aspect of the application, including graph visualization, threading, and UI.

Project Description

Algotrade is a python application that allows automation of crypto currency trade using algorithm of a user's taste. The project is still under development.

Project Difficulty

It was difficult to have a control of growing scale of the project as we add more and more functionality to the program. Especially file control and code tracing became a load of work every time there comes a need of adjustment.

My Solution

We decided to modulize the project so that we can make agile adjustment when the need comes.


Data Scrape


Technologies Used

  • python
  • Clustering
  • PCA
  • Machine Learning
  • matplotlib
  • Data mining

Project Description

There are so much data in the Internet, and yet they need data cleaning to be used in a Neural Network. To overcome the lack of clean data, I used hierarchical clustering algorithm with PCA to let machine label data.

Limitation to Note

The result of the project did not reach my expectation. Only the small portion of the original data was able to be labeled by the program. Also, due to the ambiguity that data transformation (PCA) creates, the arbitrary classification becomes insensible to human.

Result

Although the project did not match to my expectation, I learned a scientific approach to ML problems, and this project is only the beginning of my journey to ML.
